content.question: <math alttext="the derivative, with respect to x, of, open parenthesis, the integral from, 1 to x, of, t to the fourth power, plus t squared, plus 1, d t, close parenthesis, equals " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo></mrow><mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

choices.label: <math alttext="x to the fourth power, plus x squared, plus 1 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4 x cubed, plus 2 x " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="x to the fourth power, plus x squared, minus 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4 x cubed, plus 2 x, minus 6 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="x to the fourth power, plus x squared, plus 1 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
